availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Wheeler Sr. (Union County, Kentucky, bootmaker, druggist, police judge, and postmaster)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, postmaster, bootmaker, druggist, and police judge. New Hampshire native. Married to Jane E. Wheeler. Father of William H. Wheeler. Bootmaker in Union County, Kentucky, in 1850. Postmaster in Uniontown from March 27, 1858, to February 14, 1860. Druggist in Uniontown in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Uniontown in 1860. Police judge in Union County in 1861. Postmaster in Uniontown from June 13, 1861, to July 3, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 1, p. 458A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Uniontown, p. 542.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Uniontown, p. 418A.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, X County, Kentucky, vol. 28, 188-89.
KYR-0001-017-0195.
